title: whats up with the new generation of LoL players
body: so i started using my brothers account (lvl 7) so i guess you can say i was smurfin. And when i got into my first champ select there was instalocking flamers in chat so much swearing involved and so i had to dodge because we had 3 mid (= .=) but when i got into a new champ select it happened again and it kept going and going their all still learning and bad ingame and yet they acted as if they controlled the team like they were hitler or something.. i just hate seeing the community getting worse. i almost raged at one of them when they told me "if you dont want to go another lane then dodge you're the one who has to wait 5 more minutes to play.

replies.body:
People be like

A - what lvl r u

B - im lvl 10

A - I’m lvl11 do wut i say i’m more pro den u

B - I’m no listening to u

C - guys I’m lvl 20 i tell u wut to do

A - …..

B - …..

A & B - wow noob lvl 20 getting matched with us u probs suk more than us dats why ur matched with us

Implying the League community was even any better.

It's been terrible since S2.
This is why I do pre made 5s when I'm on my smurf. I made one yesterday. Much easier than queuing up on your own.

Sometimes when there are 3 people mid...etc its not because they are trying to intentionally do something wrong, its that they don't know the standard lane numbers.

I know when I first started playing that I had no idea only 1 person was meant to go mid, I just thought that there were 3 lanes and 5 champs, so 2 will have 2 and 1 will have 1, and that the number of bots in each lane was either random or matched the number of players in the lane.

I also didn't realize that you got less gold with more people in the lane and less experience.

Being level 7, they have probably only played 10 or so bot games and still don't have a clue whats going on. Its the same with low MMR pvp games, no1 knows how to jungle, everyone just lanes and takes super huge risks against the other player as they are used to playing against a bot who at low hp will try to run away instead of landing that last spell or move that will kill you.

When I play on my smurf I just play anywhere I'm needed and don't try too hard. I know I can usually crush the other team from any lane if they aren't smurfs themselves so no need to put them off the game altogether. There's enough bad eggs in this community, no need to create new ones

I usually find a "lot" of players like you and problems start right from the game section window because you guys are expert BUT you don't understand that others need to play many more games to feel more confident.
What does "instalocking" mean?
I usually lock my champion before stating my position because the game allows me also that is my right, there isn't any rules about this.
Then "smarf" players start harassing me because they say that I auto locked and they even find fans who encourage the spamming because they all know each other.
That is a moment when I feel like smarf players are a negative poison for this game.
You are a smarf player so you should never "pretend" that other less expert players behave the way you would like to see because by telling it doesn't change anything but only it makes the whole gaming experience unpleasant and unfriendly.

Is this bait. This looks a lot like bait.

What happens when a team of five players all with your mind set decide they all want to top and lock in before declaring that they are all going to go top? 'Instalocking' is a selfish behaviour. The only time instalocking is even remotely acceptable is if you're comfortable filling any role with the champ you've chosen.

A toddler tries to take what they want with no regard to others and cry when they don't get it. Mature adults will bargain, reason, and come to a compromise for the best possible outcome *for all players*, not just themselves.

There are too many toddlers in this game. You're not entitled to anything more than the rest of your team.

You're right though. People can't tell you what to do. We all need to be mature adults by our own sheer willpower.
